{{also|黃金}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-see|黃金}}

----

==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|おう|こん|k2=ごん|r=1}}
{{IPAchar|/waugon/}} → {{IPAchar|/wɔːgon/}} → {{IPAchar|/oːgon/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=おうごん}} {{m|zh|黃金|tr=hwang kim|lit=yellow + metal}}. Compare modern {{etyl|yue|-}} ''wong<sup>4</sup> gam<sup>1</sup>''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|おうごん|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|おうごん|hhira=わうごん}}

# The metal [[gold]] (Au).
# The color [[gold]].
# [[money|Money]], more specifically, the large {{m|ja|大判|tr=ōban}} gold coins formerly used in Japan.

=====Usage notes=====
The reading ''ōgon'' is the more common [[on'yomi]] for this term.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|color}}
** {{ja-r|黄金色|こがね いろ}}
** {{ja-r|金色|きんいろ}}; {{ja-r|金色|きんしょく}}; {{ja-r|金色|こんじき}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|こう|きん}}
{{IPAchar|/kwaukin/}} → {{IPAchar|/kwɔːkin/}} → {{IPAchar|/koːkin/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=こうきん}} {{m|zh|黃金|tr=hwang kim|lit=yellow + metal}}. Compare modern {{etyl|nan|-}} reading ''hông-kim''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|こうきん}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|こうきん|hhira=くわうきん}}

# [[money|Money]].
# The metal [[gold]] (Au).
# The color [[gold]].

=====Usage notes=====
The ''kōkin'' reading appears to be [[obsolete]]. The reading ''ōgon'' is the more common [[on'yomi]] for this term.

===Etymology 3===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=きがね|黄|tr1=ki|t1=yellow|金|tr2=kane|t2=metal}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> {{rendaku2|sort=きがね|kane|gane}}

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|きがね}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|きがね|kigane}}

# The metal [[gold]] (Au).
# [[money|Money]]. In modern Japanese, often refers to the large {{m|ja|大判|tr=ōban}} or smaller {{m|ja|小判|tr=koban}} gold coins formerly used in Japan.

=====Usage notes=====
The ''kigane'' reading appears to be [[rare]]. The reading ''kogane'' is the more common [[kun'yomi]] for this term.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

===Etymology 4===
Variant of ''kigane'' above.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|くがね}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|金}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|くがね}}

# The metal [[gold]] (Au).
# [[money|Money]].

=====Usage notes=====
The reading ''kogane'' is the more common [[kun'yomi]] for this term.

===Etymology 5===
Variant of ''kugane'' above.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|こがね|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|金}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|こがね}}

# The metal [[gold]] (Au).
# [[money|Money]].
# The color [[gold]].
# Short for {{m|ja|黄金の泥|tr=kogane no dei}}: powdered gold suspended in a base and used as a [[paint]].

=====Usage notes=====
The reading ''kogane'' is the more common [[kun'yomi]] for this term.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|color}}
** {{ja-r|黄金色|こがね いろ}}
** {{ja-r|金色|きんいろ}}; {{ja-r|金色|きんしょく}}; {{ja-r|金色|こんじき}}
* {{sense|gold paint}}
** {{ja-r|小金の泥|こがね の でい}}
** {{ja-r|金泥|こんでい}}
